partials.notes package

Submodules

partials.notes.note module

This file contains the laternate Note class

class partials.notes.note.Note(asset_path='assets/images/notes/C.png', Screen_Width=800, Screen_Height=600)[source]

Bases: Sprite

A class representing musical notes in a game.

surf

The image surface of the note.

Type:

pygame.Surface

rect

The rectangular area representing the note’s position and size.

Type:

pygame.Rect

Parameters:

  • asset_path (str) – The file path to the image of the note (default: “assets/images/notes/C.png”).

  • Screen_Width (int) – The width of the game screen (default: 800).

  • Screen_Height (int) – The height of the game screen (default: 600).

Note

The note’s starting position is randomly generated within the screen boundaries.

update()[source]

Moves the note based on a constant speed and removes it when it passes the left edge of the screen.

partials.notes.text_note module

class partials.notes.text_note.Note(midi=40, text='O', tab_line=1, time_to_next_note=1.0, font_size=70, font_color=(0, 0, 0), font_name='freesansbold.ttf', Screen_Width=800, Screen_Height=600, id=0)[source]

Bases: Sprite

A class representing a musical note in the game.

midi

The MIDI value of the note.

Type:

int

text

The text representation of the note.

Type:

str

tab_line

The tab line on which the note is placed.

Type:

int

time_to_next_note

The time (in beats) until the next note.

Type:

float

font_size

The size of the font for rendering the note.

Type:

int

font_color

The RGB color tuple for the font.

Type:

tuple

The name of the font used for rendering.

Type:

str

Type:

int

The height of the game screen.

Type:

Type:

Type:

check_correct_note(predicted_midi_arr)[source]

Checks if the given MIDI note matches the predicted MIDI notes.

Parameters:

predicted_midi_arr (list of int) – List of predicted MIDI notes to compare against.

Returns:

True if the note was played correctly, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

get_x_location()[source]

set_active_color()[source]

Set the active color for the text.

Sets the is_active attribute to True, updates the font_color attribute to the active color (0,0,255), and re-renders the text surface using the updated font color.

Parameters:

self – The class instance.

Returns:

None

set_missed_color()[source]

Sets the font color to red (255, 0, 0) and updates the rendering surface.

set_played_color()[source]

Sets the font color to green (RGB: 0, 255, 0) and updates the rendered surface accordingly.

This method modifies the font_color attribute of the object to represent green color and updates the surf attribute by rendering the text with the updated font color.

Parameters:

self – The object instance.

Returns:

None

set_x_location(x_value=100)[source]

Set the x-location of the object.

Parameters:

x_value (int, optional) – The x-coordinate value to set for the object’s location. Defaults to 100.

Returns:

None

update()[source]

Move the note based on a constant speed and remove it when it passes the left edge of the screen.
